commit_message:
Enable additional gate checks

 Changes to murano-deployment repo should be
checked by all murano gates since they all are
dependent from scripts placed in murano-deployment
repository.
 This commit achieves this by adding
set_params function which does next:
 - launches gate-murano-* jobs on master branch
 - sets MURANO_DEPLOYMENT_REF parameter to
   ref of needed murano-deployment change for gate-murano-*
   jobs

Change-Id: I11a877569d793dc4d6f80fa09645facc605ec3d0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-deployment refs/changes/64/343664/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import re params['OFFLINE_NODE_WHEN_COMPLETE'] = '1' def set_params(item, job, params): single_use_node(item, job, params) # every time we are changing murano-deployment, we need to run # other dependent jobs with this change to be sure they are not broken if params['ZUUL_PROJECT'] == 'openstack/murano-deployment': if job.name != 'gate-murano-deployment': if job.name == 'gate-murano-client-ubuntu': project_name = 'python-muranoclient' else: project_name = re.sub(r'gate-|-ubuntu|coverage-', '', job.name) deployment_ref = params['ZUUL_CHANGES'].rpartition(':')[2] params['MURANO_DEPLOYMENT_REF'] = deployment_ref params['ZUUL_REF'] = params.get('ZUUL_BRANCH', 'master') params['ZUUL_URL'] = 'https://git.openstack.org' params['ZUUL_PROJECT'] = "openstack/%s" % project_name

commit_message:
Add more syntax checks

Checks added:
 - for all yaml files
 - for all puppet manifests
 - for all erb templates

Change-Id: I022c7307569224eefb11a7515772513c0f908157
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-deployment refs/changes/08/346108/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Validate yaml syntax find "${CI_ROOT_DIR}" -name "*.yaml" | while read file; do ruby -e "require 'yaml'; YAML.load_file('${file}')" done # Validate puppet templates syntax find "${CI_ROOT_DIR}" -name "*.erb" | while read file; do erb -P -x -T '-' example.erb | ruby -c done # Validate puppet scripts syntax find "${CI_ROOT_DIR}" -name "*.pp" | while read file; do puppet parser validate $file done

commit_message:
carbonara: embed a benchmark tool

Change-Id: I6f8c6a3f78f484203a6f983e883f38d8fdbaf665
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/52/347452/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import mathimport random @classmethod def benchmark(cls): """Run a speed benchmark!""" points = cls.POINTS_PER_SPLIT sampling = 5 compress_times = 50 now = datetime.datetime(2015, 4, 3, 23, 11) for title, values in [ ("Simple continuous range", six.moves.range(points)), ("All 0", [float(0)] * points), ("All 1", [float(1)] * points), ("0 and 1", [0, 1] * (points // 2)), ("1 and 0 random", [random.randint(0, 1) for x in six.moves.range(points)]), ("Small number random pos/neg", [random.randint(-100000, 10000) for x in six.moves.range(points)]), ("Small number random pos", [random.randint(0, 20000) for x in six.moves.range(points)]), ("Small number random neg", [random.randint(-20000, 0) for x in six.moves.range(points)]), ("Sin(x)", map(math.sin, six.moves.range(points))), ("random ", [random.random() for x in six.moves.range(points)]), ]: pts = pandas.Series(values, [now + datetime.timedelta(seconds=i*sampling) for i in six.moves.range(points)]) ts = cls(ts=pts, sampling=sampling, aggregation_method='mean') t0 = time.time() for i in six.moves.range(compress_times): s = ts.serialize() t1 = time.time() print(title) print(" Bytes per point: %.2f" % (len(s) / float(points))) print(" Compression speed: %.2f MB/s" % ((len(msgpack.dumps(ts.to_dict())) / ((t1 - t0) / compress_times)) / (1024.0 * 1024.0))) if __name__ == '__main__': AggregatedTimeSerie.benchmark()

commit_message:
Add ansible playbook for removing compute

This commit adds a playbook and for removing a compute node from an
OpenStack-Ansible environment. It also introduces a directory structure
for ansible related tools.

Change-Id: I806148974fd0f4b05f6e455a4444e7c70ba05f9a
Closes-Bug: #1588821
Related: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/340458

commit_message:
Add a test for all available slave nodes bootstrap

This test is useful for preparing baremetal environment
for further manual testing.

Related blueprint run-fuel-qa-on-baremetal
Change-Id: Id3002ffc147e284a5d349d13b43d9a741d7fce04
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/89/327289/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test(depends_on=[prepare_release], groups=["prepare_slaves_all"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def prepare_slaves_all(self): """Bootstrap all slave nodes Scenario: 1. Revert snapshot "ready" 2. Start 9 slave nodes Snapshot: ready_with_all_slaves """ self.check_run("ready_with_all_slaves") self.show_step(1, initialize=True) self.env.revert_snapshot("ready", skip_timesync=True) # Bootstrap by 5 slaves at the same time self.show_step(2) slaves = self.env.d_env.nodes().slaves[:] while slaves: slaves_to_bootstrap = slaves[:5] self.env.bootstrap_nodes(slaves_to_bootstrap, skip_timesync=True) del slaves[:5] self.env.make_snapshot("ready_with_all_slaves", is_make=True) self.current_log_step = 0

commit_message:
Fix python3.5 unit test failure

Test NovaScenarioTestCase.test__boot_server_5 failed for gate job
gate-rally-python35-nv.
This happened because for different versions python, behaviour of set()
changes.

Change-Id: I6615bfe090d560e1f0a3d3b17672978f89858357
Closes-Bug: #1606537

v1.0, v1.1 and v2

added_lines: from sahara.service.validations import base as base_v@v.validate_pagination(base_v.check_cluster_exists) def clusters_list(limit=None): result = api.get_clusters(**u.get_request_args().to_dict()) return u.render_pagination( res={"clusters": [t.to_dict() for t in result]}, method_name="clusters", prev=result.prev, _next=result.next, limit=limit, api_version="1.0" )@v.validate_pagination(base_v.check_cluster_template_exists) def cluster_templates_list(limit=None): result = api.get_cluster_templates( **u.get_request_args().to_dict()) return u.render_pagination( res={"cluster_templates": [t.to_dict() for t in result]}, method_name="cluster-templates", prev=result.prev, _next=result.next, limit=limit, api_version="1.0" )@v.validate_pagination(base_v.check_node_group_template_exists) def node_group_templates_list(limit=None): result = api.get_node_group_templates( **u.get_request_args().to_dict()) return u.render_pagination( res={"node_group_templates": [t for t in result]}, method_name="node-group-templates", prev=result.prev, _next=result.next, limit=limit, api_version="1.0" )
deleted_lines: def clusters_list(): return u.render(clusters=[c.to_dict() for c in api.get_clusters( **u.get_request_args().to_dict())])def cluster_templates_list(): return u.render( cluster_templates=[t.to_dict() for t in api.get_cluster_templates( **u.get_request_args().to_dict())])def node_group_templates_list(): return u.render( node_group_templates=[t.to_dict() for t in api.get_node_group_templates( **u.get_request_args().to_dict())])

commit_message:
[CI] Fix devstack hooks to unblock CI

Logic of share-network creation was dependent on presense of "JOB_NAME"
env var. And it is unavailable now. Moreover, we do not really need to
depend on it. Therefore, remove dependency on it and assume we always
run CI without nova-network enabled.

Change-Id: Ic03e2166101a4deb13e8a8545d2fb2506454a20a
Closes-Bug: #1595160
(cherry picked from commit 6e156835399a58bf5cabe15942a7fdc9e1104bc9)
(cherry picked from commit a919058515d7210cd448b0646c4592d6efeb7e73)

commit_message:
Fix OVSBridge.set_protocols arg

For native ovsdb_interface compatibility, use a list instead of
a comma separated string for set_protocols argument.  The native
interface failed silently.

Change-Id: Idc6fce9f943b2fe64f668bcfaf9ed40fcf47034c
Closes-Bug: 1597613
(cherry picked from commit ce644b821ad1b86120f47633816eaef8c2c1235e)

gitignore *.spec files

inclusion.

commit_message:
nova: n-sproxy config consistency

This change makes the configuration of the serial_console section in the
nova.conf file consistent to that like the other console sections (VNC/SPICE).
That means, if the n-sproxy service is not enabled, disable the feature in
the nova.conf file. This should avoid confusion for people who expect the
feature to work after enabling the necessary service.

Change-Id: I5977b9a275e1451fa3baf37ae6e1130371249fef

commit_message:
profile/base/nova: declare nova class and configure cache correctly.

Nova {} workaround is not working correctly, we need to merge this patch
so we can move out ::nova from THT completely.

Also we need to use nova::cache to configure memcached parameters.

Co-Authorized-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Co-Authorized-By: Sven Anderson <sven@redhat.com>
Co-Authorized-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow tox to be run with python 3

The tox.ini has some unicode characters that cannot be
decoded, so just executing tox will immediately cause an error
because the tox.ini cannot be parsed.

Closes-Bug: #1600068
Change-Id: Ia01ae80d9321584845bb06c3f6673d13027bd2db
(cherry picked from commit b06c7e857edbffe21745e0c85b021cc2d7423a7f)

commit_message:
Macvtap: Allow noop alias as FW driver

The macvtap agent only works with the NoopFWDriver. If another
driver is configured it terminates. Today only the explicit
configuration "neutron.agent.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver" is
accepted. This patch enables the macvtap agent to also accept
the alias "noop"

Change-Id: I0d6f0b780a3881419243f12487e8b3d10e709f6c
Closes-Bug: #1587498
(cherry picked from commit 96d1d914ca0976fb6e8c7962d4d97f8553c4847e)

Only the NoopFirewallDriver is ' 'supported by macvtap agent, but "%s" is configured. ' 'Set the firewall_driver to "noop" and start the ' 'agent again. Agent terminated!'),

commit_message:
Lower ML2 message severity.

Logging that a network has no segments as an error
message when it doesn't impact execution pollutes
logs.  Lower the message severity to debug.

Change-Id: I7d88581b4703e7c287cec9406dd093089db8595c
Closes-Bug: #1597362
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 00f3ab1f132de6b701c7832626457ad51dd265b6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/57/347057/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug("Network %s has no segments", network['id'])

commit_message:
Add api-ref for new port fields

API microversions 1.18, 1.19 introduced new fields in Port resource,
this change adds them to api-ref documentation.

Partial-bug: #1526403

Change-Id: Ib7059fd1ec8ffc54fa34647cc558fb8c8e80f8d7

commit_message:
Add CLI tests to check JSON response body

Test JSON response output to console for commands:
node-list,
node-show,
node-validate,
node-show-states,
node-create,
node-update.

Change-Id: Id1ebff7cedb6e5b9f657d869d71f49de270a5ef3
Partial-Bug: #1555680

deleted_lines: def show_driver(self, driver_name): driver_show = self.ironic('driver-show', params=driver_name)

commit_message:
don't hardcode keystone-package tag to memcached package

Do not hardcode keystone-package tag to memcached package because
resource can already be in catalog with another tag. Keep standard
'openstack' tag.

Depends-On: I3e400a5f64b85f0d374fc02cc5e4080d19d0f2e4
Change-Id: I52d5badb9960124bb8fcb54983db2853c4185e77

commit_message:
cache: don't hardcode keystone-package tag to memcached package

Do not hardcode keystone-package tag to memcached package because the
resource can already be in catalog with another tag. Keep standard
'openstack' tag.

Change-Id: I3e400a5f64b85f0d374fc02cc5e4080d19d0f2e4

commit_message:
[Verify] Adding '--skip-list' arg to `rally verify start` cmd

Sometimes we need to run the full test suite without some tests.
Now the new '--skip-list' argument allows us to do it. In order to skip
the desired tests we just need to list the tests in some file and provide
the '--skip-list' argument with the path to the file:

    rally verify start --skip-list /path/to/the/file

Also, missing messages about incompatibility of arguments were added.

Change-Id: I882bfacd2e39bed2b54af4092752f642c964975a

commit_message:
Lower ML2 message severity.

Logging that a network has no segments as an error
message when it doesn't impact execution pollutes
logs.  Lower the message severity to debug.

Change-Id: I7d88581b4703e7c287cec9406dd093089db8595c
Closes-Bug: #1597362
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 00f3ab1f132de6b701c7832626457ad51dd265b6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/59/347059/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug("Network %s has no segments", network['id'])

The following patch updates initialize_connection
API to use volume versionedobjects.  Changes were
made to be backwards compatible with older RPC clients.
It only includes changes to the core cinder code.
Changes in the drivers are left to each driver
maintainer to update.

Note that this patch DOES NOT try to use object dot
notation everywhere, since it would increase the
size of the patch.  Instead, it will be done in
subsequent patches.

Co-Authored-By: Thang Pham <thang.g.pham@gmail.com>

made to be backwards compatible with older RPC clients.
It only includes changes to the core cinder code.
Changes in the drivers are left to each driver
maintainer to update.

Note that this patch DOES NOT try to use object dot
notation everywhere, since it would increase the
size of the patch.  Instead, it will be done in
subsequent patches.

Co-Authored-By: Thang Pham <thang.g.pham@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ib45cf5934b09fb2de9c228160bbad39c8a896e26

commit_message:
Update initialize_connection to use versionedobjects

The following patch updates initialize_connection
API to use volume versionedobjects.  Changes were
made to be backwards compatible with older RPC clients.
It only includes changes to the core cinder code.
Changes in the drivers are left to each driver
maintainer to update.

Note that this patch DOES NOT try to use object dot
notation everywhere, since it would increase the
size of the patch.  Instead, it will be done in
subsequent patches.

Co-Authored-By: Thang Pham <thang.g.pham@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ib45cf5934b09fb2de9c228160bbad39c8a896e26
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

added_lines: config_drive_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('config_drive_format',"""), cfg.BoolOpt('force_config_drive',"""), cfg.StrOpt('mkisofs_cmd',"""), ] conf.register_opts(config_drive_opts) return {"DEFAULT": config_drive_opts}
deleted_lines: # needs:fix_opt_description_indentation # needs:fix_opt_registration_consistency config_drive_format_opt = cfg.StrOpt('config_drive_format',""") force_config_drive_opt = cfg.BoolOpt('force_config_drive',""") mkisofs_cmd_opt = cfg.StrOpt('mkisofs_cmd',""") ALL_OPTS = [config_drive_format_opt, force_config_drive_opt, mkisofs_cmd_opt] conf.register_opts(ALL_OPTS) return {"DEFAULT": ALL_OPTS}

commit_message:
Remove usage of private '_url' property from OSC

Due to a recent change in OSC (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329189/)
some attributes that were previously private but available were removed.
This patch just assumes that the url is not available and gets the
endpoint regardless. It removes the necessecity for accessing the
private property.

Change-Id: I680f1a76aab1a94883bc58de241fd0d65d1cb78a
Closes-Bug: #1605876
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-mistralclient refs/changes/54/347354/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mistral_url = instance.get_endpoint_for_service_type( 'workflowv2', interface='publicURL' ) mistral_url=mistral_url,
deleted_lines: if not instance._url: instance._url = instance.get_endpoint_for_service_type( 'workflowv2', interface='publicURL' ) mistral_url=instance._url,

subject: Use lbaas alias instead of the class name

commit_message:
Use lbaas alias instead of the class name

Plugin alias is recommended to use.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Tighten the trusty job filter for OpenStack-Ansible properly

Only the functional jobs should run, not the docs jobs too. As the
functional jobs could be 'func' or any other name, a negative match
is used on the docs job name instead.

The previous attempt at this didn't work properly.

The following should not pass the regex test:
- gate-openstack-ansible-docs-ubuntu-trusty-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-docs-ubuntu-trusty
- gate-openstack-ansible-repo_build-ansible-docs-ubuntu-trusty-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-repo_build-ansible-docs-ubuntu-trusty

The following should pass the regex test:
- gate-openstack-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty
- gate-openstack-ansible-repo_build-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty-nv
- gate-openstack-ansible-repo_build-ansible-func-ubuntu-trusty

Change-Id: I595c926d1e441777303c6f5ecb68ba72abbae0c6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/52/347952/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Change cinder backup to define full backup or incremental backup

Now, freezer backup cinder through cindernative, if volume have a
backup, it must be incremental, it is unfriendly.
Increase  incremental parameter to backup cinder volume. Default
freezer backup volume do a full backup, if cremental, it shoud do
a incremental backup.

eg:

Do a full backup:
freezer-agent --cindernative-vol-id eb7e8d07-800f-4de8-a918-38aa36e2ef83

Do a incremental backup:

freezer-agent --cindernative-vol-id eb7e8d07-800f-4de8-a918-38aa36e2ef83 --incremental

Closes-Bug: #1592322

Change-Id: I31c8c2875e275511448d4dcb53425d011e91bb5d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/59/329359/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: backup_os.backup_cinder(self.conf.cindernative_vol_id, incremental=self.conf.incremental)

commit_message:
py3: Fix encoding and use sys.stdin.buffer

* exc.py: Encode body in response before calling replace over it.
* http.py: prepend the bytes literal to the empty string or else
  we hit bug 1342080 again in python 3.
* utils.py: Use sys.stdin.buffer in python 3.

Change-Id: Ieefb8c633658e507486438e5518c5d53e819027d

commit_message:
Put neutron provider commands in neutron.rb

This allows to gain access to all neutron commands using composability,
see[1] for an example.  It removes some redundancy as well.  Finally, it
looks more like the openstacklib/**/openstack.rb provider code.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347468/

Change-Id: Iad0354f5babd86822e37053f3f7a1134803fd4f8

commit_message:
freezer-api README.rst needs to be updated

Info of API registration in README.rst is not updated with the
latest openstack version. Change user-create/service-create/endpoint-create
from keystone command to openstack command.

Closes-bug: #1592242
Change-Id: Iff1924632835f92278e0cc7a666b8056655bd8e7

commit_message:
TCP-based messenging support

This adds several simple classes which may be used to exchange messages
over an established tcp connection and watch if this connection is
interrupted.

This will used by MuranoPL debugger

Change-Id: Ie9936f5e16ca76127d8d211ad0f2ef347b69f738
Targets-blueprint: muranopl-debugger
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-muranoclient refs/changes/63/174963/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import cPickle import Queue import select import socket import struct import eventlet import muranoclient.common.messaging.exceptions as exc class SocketMessenger(object): """Simple messenger to communicate over a duplex tcp sockets without closing the connection between messages. It runs two eventlet coroutines to listen on incoming messages and send the outgoing ones. The messages are serialized using cPickle and are proceeded by their length headers. The messenger will notify the consumer if the connection to remote party is lost """ def __init__(self, connection_socket, on_disconnect=None): """Creates a new socket messenger running over a specific socket :param connection_socket: socket to use for communications :param on_disconnect: function to execute when the connection with the remote party is lost """ self.socket = connection_socket self.error = False self.active = True self.on_disconnect = on_disconnect self._incoming = Queue.Queue() self._outgoing = Queue.Queue() self._pool = eventlet.GreenPool() self._send_routine = self._pool.spawn(self._send_loop) self._receive_routine = self._pool.spawn(self._receive_loop) def close(self): """Closes the messenger by closing its underlying socket and stopping both its send and receive loops """ if self.active: self.active = False self._close() self._pool.waitall() def receive(self): """Waits for a next message to be received by a messenger :returns received message """ res = self._incoming.get() return res def send(self, message): """Schedules a message to be sent by the messenger :returns True is the messenger is active and can send messages, False otherwise """ if not self.active: return False self._outgoing.put(message) return True def _send_loop(self): while self.active: m = self._outgoing.get() if m is None: continue try: self._send_message(m) except exc.ConnectionClosedException: self._handle_exception() break def _receive_loop(self): while self.active: try: m = self._receive_message() if m is None: continue except exc.ConnectionClosedException: self._handle_exception() break self._incoming.put(m) def _handle_exception(self): if self.active: self.error = True self.active = False self._close() if self.on_disconnect is not None: self.on_disconnect(self) def _send_message(self, message): data = cPickle.dumps(message) header = struct.pack('l', len(data)) try: self.socket.sendall(header) self.socket.sendall(data) except socket.error: raise exc.ConnectionClosedException("Socket Error on Send") def _receive_message(self): header = self._read_bytes(8) message_length = struct.unpack('l', header)[0] try: data = self._read_bytes(message_length) return cPickle.loads(data) except socket.error: raise exc.ConnectionClosedException("Socket Error on Receive") def _read_bytes(self, amount): res = '' bytes_read = 0 while bytes_read < amount: r, _, _ = select.select([self.socket], [], [], 1) if not self.active: raise exc.ConnectionClosedException("Connection closed while " "waiting for data") else: if not r: # select timeout, repeat continue to_read = min(4048, amount - bytes_read) data = self.socket.recv(to_read) if data == '': raise exc.ConnectionClosedException("Connection closed by " "remote party") bytes_read += len(data) res += data return res def _close(self): # Queue.put(None) is needed to notify the threads # waiting for messages to be read from queues self._outgoing.put(None) self._incoming.put(None) try: self.socket.shutdown(socket.SHUT_RDWR) self.socket.close() except socket.error: pass # the socket may be already closed by an error class MessagingServer(object): """Server listening on a specific tcp port for incoming connections and creating SocketMessenger for each connected client. May maintain the maximum number of connected clients and will close all the connections which exceed the limit. May notify the consumer when new client is connected or disconnected. """ def __init__(self, host, port, max_clients=0, on_client_connected=None, on_client_disconnected=None): self.max_clients = max_clients self.clients = [] self.server_socket = None self.host = host self.port = port self.active = False self._accept_loop = None self.on_client_connected = on_client_connected self.on_client_disconnected = on_client_disconnected def run(self): """Starts the server by opening a listening socket and running an accept loop """ self.active = True self.server_socket = eventlet.listen((self.host, self.port)) self._accept_loop = eventlet.spawn(self._accept) def stop(self): """Stops the server. The listening socket is closed and accept loop terminated To interrupt the accept loop a fake connection is made. """ self.active = False # Making a fake connection to interrupt the listener loop temp = eventlet.connect((self.host, self.port)) temp.close() self._accept_loop.wait() self.server_socket.close() for client in self.clients: client.close() def _accept(self): while self.active: client_socket, client_address = self.server_socket.accept() if self.active: self._client_connected(client_socket, client_address) def _client_connected(self, client_socket, client_address): if len(self.clients) >= self.max_clients != 0: # Too many clients, refusing client_socket.close() return sm = SocketMessenger(client_socket, self._client_disconnected) self.clients.append(sm) if self.on_client_connected is not None: self.on_client_connected(self, sm) def _client_disconnected(self, client): if client in self.clients: self.clients.remove(client) if self.on_client_disconnected is not None: self.on_client_disconnected(self, client) def connect(host, port): """Establishes a connection to a server listening on a specific host and port :param host: host address :param port: port number :returns SocketMessenger object for established connection """ client_socket = eventlet.connect((host, port)) return SocketMessenger(client_socket)

Typically includes performance requirements like networking bandwidth, latency, jitter correction, and reliability as well as storage performance in Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPS), throttling agreements, and performance expectations at peak load.

commit_message:
Make create_object_with_dependency cleanup

This adjusts the create_object_with_dependency helper function
to attempt to cleanup any dependency it was responsible for creating
if it encounters a failure in trying to attach a child to the
dependency.

Change-Id: I363f3a299c55e5063b4239028728bb5593132010

added_lines: Quality of Service (QoS) The ability to guarantee certain network or storage requirements to satisfy a Service Level Agreement (SLA) between an application provider and end users. Typically includes performance requirements like networking bandwidth, latency, jitter correction, and reliability as well as storage performance in Input/Output Operations Per Second (IOPS), throttling agreements, and performance expectations at peak load.

subject: Extend specs matcher to support ">" and "<"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 16:11:18.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/specs_matcher.py', 'oslo_utils/tests/test_specs_matcher.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.utils/commit/f43d78d358aebba94b8cf644b1352a8b9e401f53', 'message': 'Extend specs matcher to support ">" and "<"

This patch is exteding the specs matcher and adding support for the ">"
and "<" operators. Prior to this patch, only the "equal" forms were
supported (">=" and "<=").

It also looks inconsistent because for the "s" prefixed operators all
the 4 forms are supported already: "s<=", "s<", "s>=" and "s>".

Change-Id: I82a72b0ef6ee277e7b09b0eb138e058687ce8804
'}]
commit_message:
Extend specs matcher to support ">" and "<"

This patch is exteding the specs matcher and adding support for the ">"
and "<" operators. Prior to this patch, only the "equal" forms were
supported (">=" and "<=").

It also looks inconsistent because for the "s" prefixed operators all
the 4 forms are supported already: "s<=", "s<", "s>=" and "s>".

Change-Id: I82a72b0ef6ee277e7b09b0eb138e058687ce8804

commit_message:
Update Versioned Objects with Cluster object

This patch adds Cluster Versioned Object as counterpart for the Cluster
ORM class, and updates ConsistencyGroup, Volume, and Service Versioned
Objects.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/327283
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Ie6857cf7db52cf284d89bad704e2c679e5549966

subject: disable lazy translation in sphinx extension
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 15:37:00.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/sphinxext.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/b40925328e5ba9e87be42bab1ec3a41bf3d81f78', 'message': "disable lazy translation in sphinx extension

The sphinx extension depends on all of the help text associated with an
option being regular strings. When oslo_i18n's lazy translation feature
is turned on, the marker functions return Message objects that do not
support all of the features of strings. Add a step to turn off lazy
evaluation when the oslo_context.sphinxext extension is activated.

Change-Id: Icaec4691135cd07d96994f01498e0f9d2e09af58
Closes-Bug: #1605648
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
disable lazy translation in sphinx extension

The sphinx extension depends on all of the help text associated with an
option being regular strings. When oslo_i18n's lazy translation feature
is turned on, the marker functions return Message objects that do not
support all of the features of strings. Add a step to turn off lazy
evaluation when the oslo_context.sphinxext extension is activated.

Change-Id: Icaec4691135cd07d96994f01498e0f9d2e09af58
Closes-Bug: #1605648
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/07/347907/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import oslo_i18n # NOTE(dhellmann): Try to turn off lazy translation from oslo_i18n # so any translated help text or deprecation messages associated # with configuration options are treated as regular strings # instead of Message objects. Unfortunately this is a bit # order-dependent, and so it's still possible that importing code # from another module such as through the autodoc features, or # even through the plugin scanner, will turn lazy evaluation back # on. oslo_i18n.enable_lazy(False)

commit_message:
Add subresources support for PECAN

Implements adding a subresource (of extensions) to its parents
A resource and a subresource has a parent-child relationship, for
example:
A qos resource has a subresource of bandwith_limit_rules. This patch
will allow urls like : /qos/policies/{policy_id}/bandwidth_limit_rules to
work.

Change-Id: Ib2288234710fd6eed7fb9f6b880f57c9dd3beade

commit_message:
Migrate Puppet Hieradata to composable services

Migrate puppet/hieradata/*.yaml parameters to puppet/services/*.yaml
except for some services that are not composable yet.

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7e5f8b18ee9aa63a1dffc6facaf88315b07d5fd7

commit_message:
Release glance-store 0.15.0

The 0.14.0 failed the glance gate for docs and was blocking the review
queue. So, we need this quick follow up release to fix the glance gate
and use all the commits and fixes proposed therein from the prior one.

More explanation about the same is given in bug 1606746 and bug 1605648

Change-Id: I4d17375d2a716581633a5eb91bd6c44ff0a64ab8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/21/347621/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - version: 0.14.1 projects: - repo: openstack/glance_store hash: 10f50da5fcd9257090ab137f4d257940bb01b44a highlights: > - Fixed a critical bug 1606746 that was blocking further releases and failing gate of glance docs.

commit_message:
Move the flag --template to UpgradeEnvCommand

The flag --template was returned
from UpgradeNodeCommand to UpgradeEnvCommand,
because the problem with assigning node to cluster
with network template is resolved

Depends-On: Ibd06de87964bf7a2038899d32e3d8a0189b9cbbd
Change-Id: Ia470f674a6d6690f12d086af0ecbbdc8bc297fdd

commit_message:
release oslo.rootwrap 5.0.0

This releases oslo.rootwrap 5.0.0 which has a hard coded allow for
privsep-helper to assist in the upgrade and transition to privsep in
projects and libraries. It is a major release because of this
addition.

Change-Id: I791fc2d450fafbc56a12804d8daf88a08a9ef214

commit_message:
Fix handler case where no old process is found

In cases where no old process was found, the shell
command was exiting 1 and causing the handler to report
a failure.

Change-Id: Ic1701f7495abdec713c05d2c95bfdd1e7b1ff73d
Closes-Bug: #1603136
(cherry picked from commit 30899b83683242e2346cbab4413409d1ea49ea5e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/98/347998/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo $(readlink -f "/proc/$ns_pid/exe") | grep -qv "{{ neutron_venv_tag }}" if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then fi

commit_message:
Assign node to cluster with network template

Don't need to assign nics and bonds to netgroups
if network template has been applied to new cluster.

Change-Id: Ibd06de87964bf7a2038899d32e3d8a0189b9cbbd
Partial-bug: 1584044

commit_message:
Replace node.create() with node.start() in warm_start_nodes

With the introduction of IpmiNode it's better to use node.start()
method, because node.create() works only for virtual slaves

Also:
+ add configurable timeout to the warm and cold restart methods

Change-Id: I4968d62c2b431271928b55672431422cb5527f7a
Closes-Bug: #1603351

commit_message:
Use regex for test group searching in console

Searching by regex is much faster and it boosts
console text parsing speed in hundreds times.

Change-Id: Ib9707695a0473b402d83172c3d7219d4e1108f0a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/70/347770/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TEST_GROUP_PATTERN = re.compile(r'run_system_test.py\s+.*--group=(\S+)\b') groups = re.findall(TEST_GROUP_PATTERN, console)
deleted_lines: groups = [keyword.split('=')[1] for line in console for keyword in line.split() if 'run_system_test.py' in line and '--group=' in keyword]

commit_message:
Fix cinder config string as per current i18n state

As described in the bug 1605648 , the translations being done on the
config string are not permitting additions so, the glance docs
generation is failing.

The glance_store 0.14.0 had to be pinned down to let glance review queue
not break. see updates on this thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2016-July/thread.html#8899

The config strings need to be non additive for translations and will
enable future releases of glance_store. Once, a appropriate fix is
published for bug 1605648 the config strings can be more flexible.

Change-Id: Ia6ed5883458f2e81e861cda02068956728e76357
Closes-Bug: 1606746
Partial-Bug: 1605648

commit_message:
Run Gnocchi MySQL jobs on Ubuntu Xenial

Gnocchi needs new features available in MySQL >= 5.6, and Trusty only
has MySQL 5.5. Switch to MySQL 5.7 by using Ubuntu Xenial.

Remove MySQL + Python 3.4 also, as we have 3.5 covered already.

Change-Id: Ia1fd815c73d568922594f68d8e9ed2a9ebc55bb0

commit_message:
Update README file for version 9.1

Describe the current workflows with octane in README.rst file.

Change-Id: Ic51af24fba70d0e2ebb3378472547b124c9d1b95
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-octane refs/changes/60/345960/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Octane upgrade workflow ## Prerequisites In this manual we assume that user manages their environment with Fuel 5.1.1 and has successfully upgraded it to Fuel 7.0 with the standard procedure. Environments with the following configuration can be upgraded with Octane: - Ubuntu operating system - HA Multinode deployment mode - KVM Compute - Neutron with VLAN segmentation - Ceph backend for Cinder AND Glance (Optional) - No additional services installed (like Sahara, Murano, Ceilometer, etc) ## Install Octane Create archive from this repository with `git archive` command and copy it to your Fuel Master host. Unpack Octane tarball to /root/ directory. Change to bin/ directory of Octane. ``` [root@fuel ~]# cd /root/octane/octane/bin ``` Run Octane script to install necessary packages on Fuel master and patch manifests and source code of components. ``` [root@fuel bin]# yum install -y git python-pip python-paramiko [root@fuel bin]# ./octane prepare ``` ## Install 7.0 Seed environment First, pick the environment of version 5.1.1 you want to upgrade. Log in to Fuel Master node and run: ``` [root@fuel bin]# fuel env ```` Find the environment you selected for upgrade and remember its ID. We will refer to it as `ORIG_ID` below. Use Octane script to create Upgrade Seed environment. ``` [root@fuel bin]# octane upgrade-env <ORIG_ID> ``` Remember the ID of resulting environment for later use, or store it to variable. We will refer to it as <SEED_ID> later on. ### Upgrade controller #1 Choose added controller nodes from the list of unallocated nodes: ``` [root@fuel bin]# fuel node | grep discover ``` Remember the IDs of the nodes and run the following command replacing <NODE_ID> with that number: ``` [root@fuel bin]# octane -v --debug install-node --isolated <ORIG_ID> <SEED_ID> \ <NODE_ID> [<NODE_ID>, ...] ``` This command will install controller(s)with version 7.0 in Upgrade Seed environment. ### Upgrade State DB State Database contains all metadata and status data of virtual resources in your cloud environment. Octane transfers that data to 7.0 environment as a part of upgrade of CIC using the following command: ``` [root@fuel bin]# octane upgrade-db <ORIG_ID> <SEED_ID> ``` Before it starts data transfer, Octane stops all services on 7.0 CICs, and disables APIs on 5.1.1 CICs, putting the environment into **Maintenance mode**. ### Upgrade Ceph cluster (OPTIONAL) Configuration of original Ceph cluster must be replicated to the 7.0 environment. Use the following command to update configuration and restart Ceph monitor at 7.0 controller: ``` [root@fuel bin]# octane upgrade-ceph <ORIG_ID> <SEED_ID> ``` Verify the successful update using the following command: ``` [root@fuel bin]# ssh root@node-<NODE_ID> "ceph health" ``` ## Replace CICs 5.1.1 with 7.0 Now start all services on 7.0 CICs with upgraded data and redirect Compute nodes from 5.1.1 CICs to 7.0 CICs. Following Octane script will start all services on 7.0 CICs, then disconnect 5.1 CICs from Management and Public networks, while keeping connection between CICs themselves, and connect 7.0 CICs to those networks: ``` [root@fuel bin]# octane upgrade-control ORIG_ID SEED_ID ``` ### Upgrade compute nodes Select a node to upgrade from the list of nodes in 5.1.1 environment: ``` [root@fuel bin]# fuel node --env <ORIG_ID> ``` Run Octane script with 'upgrade-node' command to reassign node to 7.0 environment and upgrade it. You need to specify ID of the node as a second argument. ``` [root@fuel bin]# octane upgrade-node <SEED_ID> <NODE_ID> [<NODE_ID> ...] ``` Repeat this process until all nodes are reassigned from 5.1.1 to 7.0 environment. ## Finish upgrade ### Clean up the Fuel Master node Run 'cleanup-fuel' command to revert all changes made to components of the Fuel installer and uninstall temporary packages. ``` [root@fuel bin]# ./octane cleanup-fuel ```

Suppress output from updates applying for 9.x

correctly. Lets remove this logs from info loglevel.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 08:45:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_context.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ceda32ec533d98def957b49a54eb2c2b4fc808bc', 'message': "Don't assert exact to_dict output

The context.to_dict in turn calls the oslo.context to_dict. By enforcing
the exact dictionary output of the to_dict tests will fail any time that
oslo.context changes the output of to_dict. This happened with the
release of oslo.context 2.6.0.

For nova testing purposes we should only assert properties of the
dictionary output that were added by nova and rely on oslo.context doing

Related-Bug: #1602081
Change-Id: Ib91a73a017e02b48ec01bbf8c28f946fb5120ba5

commit_message:
Don't assert exact to_dict output

The context.to_dict in turn calls the oslo.context to_dict. By enforcing
the exact dictionary output of the to_dict tests will fail any time that
oslo.context changes the output of to_dict. This happened with the
release of oslo.context 2.6.0.

For nova testing purposes we should only assert properties of the
dictionary output that were added by nova and rely on oslo.context doing
the correct thing regarding deserializing its own options.

Related-Bug: #1602081
Change-Id: Ib91a73a017e02b48ec01bbf8c28f946fb5120ba5

commit_message:
[contributor-guide] Add cloud app definition to persona.

Adds the definition of cloud application to the App Developer persona.
The definition comes from the App Ecosystem Work Group and it has been
approved by that comittee.

Change-Id: I28b7228b0d009db9ce698a928522b4c96f63c286
Closes-Bug: 1606482
Signed-off-by: Rodrigo Caballero <rodrigo.caballero.abraham@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/55/347955/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Alan develops and deploys cloud applications but does not necessarily know much about the underlying infrastructure of the cloud. Cloud applications are defined as: * Applications built using OpenStack SDK's or API's * Applications deployed atop OpenStack using Heat, Murano, or any 3rd party deployment or management tools * PaaS and container solutions running atop OpenStack The cloud instances Alan consumes can use various OpenStack projects. Alan does not know the names of the projects and has never been to an OpenStack summit.
deleted_lines: Alan develops and deploys applications for cloud instances running OpenStack. He does not know much about the underlying infrastructure of the cloud. The cloud instances he consumes can use various OpenStack projects. Alan does not know the names of the projects and has never been to an OpenStack summit.

subject: numa: avoid aborting when setting hw:numa_nodes is not integer number
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-28 08:15:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hardware.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/90d5d792af4489e17e78607c6906b5d2c4081ce7', 'message': 'numa: avoid aborting when setting hw:numa_nodes is not integer number

if we setting hw:numa_nodes not a integer number, int() translate method
will throw a ValueError, we should catch this error avoid aborting, and
set to 0 if it is not a valid value.

Change-Id: I0050ca23502bfb3a2cdbe6f0280d8a34fc0d821f
'}]
commit_message:
numa: avoid aborting when setting hw:numa_nodes is not integer number

if we setting hw:numa_nodes not a integer number, int() translate method
will throw a ValueError, we should catch this error avoid aborting, and
set to 0 if it is not a valid value.

Change-Id: I0050ca23502bfb3a2cdbe6f0280d8a34fc0d821f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/68/348168/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: nodes = int(nodes) except ValueError: nodes = 0

Add some debug output for release-note test, add further job

Add more information to see whether all branches have the proper state
and tags are available.

Run the test job also on openstack-manuals for further coverage.

commit_message:
Import i18n to use the _LW translate function

Warn is deprecated. It still used in a few place
This updates those one to use the _LW translate function for LOG.warn

commit_message:
Don't assert exact to_dict output

The context.to_dict in turn calls the oslo.context to_dict. By enforcing
the exact dictionary output of the to_dict tests will fail any time that
oslo.context changes the output of to_dict. This happened with the
release of oslo.context 2.6.0.

For nova testing purposes we should only assert properties of the
dictionary output that were added by nova and rely on oslo.context doing
the correct thing regarding deserializing its own options.

Related-Bug: #1602081
Change-Id: Ib91a73a017e02b48ec01bbf8c28f946fb5120ba5

remove overwrite net04_ext params

Nailgun set up network_type to flat and 
physnet to physnet1 for fuel 8.0.
They shouldn't been overwrite by octane on upgrade procedure.

commit_message:
Render configs always needs the cluster relation

Render configs always needs the cluster relation if it is available.
There is logic in OpenStackAPIRelationAdapters that checks to see if
this unit is alone. If it is it creates a 'cluster' namespace and
populates it with data specific to this node.  If this unit has peers
then OpenStackAPIRelationAdapters populates the cluster namespace with
PeerHARelationAdapter *if* a cluster relation has been passed in. If
the unit has peers but the Peer relation has *not* been passed in
there is no cluster namespace and rendering of config that relies on
it (namely haproxy) fails.

To fix this, check if the relation exists and if it does add it to
the list of relations used to render configs

Change-Id: I6f34c28411db957d0b55155b8671bf981084bb6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-designate refs/changes/67/347467/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add pkg dep for python-apt

The hacluster charm depends on python-apt but doesn't explicitly
install it. For other charms this has been working by accident as
they have had a dependancy on python-apt themselves in some way.
Fixing it in the hacluster charm is the correct approach but is
non-trivial so temporarily fix add it as a dep to this charm so it
is installed by the principle before hacluster is installed.

Related-Bug: #1606906

Change-Id: I07e575f7096aa528d85ac5f7f23318ceb44b66ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-aodh refs/changes/73/347773/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow all master dns nodes to send notifys

When deployed with mutliple masters the slave will reject notifys
from them so explicitly list all masters who can send notifys.

Minor fir to amulet test as designate no longer creates a default
nameserver

Change-Id: I60397375d3bda317b2b6acfcfc37686d73d1a855

commit_message:
Add internal_addresses to PeerHARelationAdapter

Add a property to PeerHARelationAdapter for accessing a list of
internal addresses of peers or private-addresses if the internal cidr
has not been set.

Change-Id: I6f166ef9ad7b93e2a24ed17429c5182a322f8a41

added_lines: self.assertEqual(peer_ra.internal_addresses, [ 'peer_unit1_internal_addr', 'peer_unit2_internal_addr', 'this_unit_internal_addr'])

commit_message:
Minor optimization and formatting corrections in Quobyte driver

Removes a superfluous rpc and improves readability of method calls
with complex parameters (see
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#calling-methods ).
Closes-Bug: #1498882
Closes-Bug: #1548227

Change-Id: I12585f213acb6f55a6e2eb1646455d79abeba930

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/43/348143/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def wait_for_volume_status(self, volume, status, retry, sleep): """Wait until volume reaches given status. :param volume: volume resource :param status: expected status of volume :param retry: how many times to retry :param sleep: seconds to sleep between the retries """ while retry: volume = self.cinder.volumes.get(volume.id) if volume.status == status: break time.sleep(sleep) retry -= 1 return volume.status == status

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/54/348154/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "POT-Creation-Date: 2016-07-27 15:33+0000\n""PO-Revision-Date: 2016-07-27 09:13+0000\n"msgid "" "Default configuration files vary by distribution. You might need to add " "these sections and options rather than modifying existing sections and " "options. Also, an ellipsis (``...``) in the configuration snippets indicates " "potential default configuration options that you should retain." msgstr "" "Les fichiers de configuration par défaut diffèrent par distribution. Vous " "pouvez être amenés à ajouter ces sections et options plutôt que de modifier " "des sections et options existantes. De plus, une ellipse (``...``) dans " "l'extrait de configuration indique d'éventuelles options de configuration " "par défaut que vous devriez conserver." msgid "Edit the ``/etc/hosts`` file to contain the following:" msgstr "Editer le fichier ``/etc/hosts`` pour qu'il contienne ce qui suit:" msgid "In the ``[DEFAULT]`` section, configure backup options:" msgstr "Dans la section ``[DEFAULT]``, configurer les options de sauvegarde:" msgid "Install and configure the backup service" msgstr "Installer et configurer le service de sauvegarde" msgid "" "Optionally, install and configure the backup service. For simplicity, this " "configuration uses the Block Storage node and the Object Storage (swift) " "driver, thus depending on the `Object Storage service <http://docs.openstack." "org/project-install-guide/newton/object-storage>`_." msgstr "" "De façon optionnelle, installer et configurer le service de sauvegarde. Pour " "simplifier, cette configuration utilise le nœud de Stockage par blocs et le " "driver de Stockage Objet (swift), ainsi elle dépent du `service de Stockage " "Objet <http://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/newton/object-" "storage>`_." msgid "" "Some distributions add an extraneous entry in the ``/etc/hosts`` file that " "resolves the actual hostname to another loopback IP address such as " "``127.0.1.1``. You must comment out or remove this entry to prevent name " "resolution problems. **Do not remove the 127.0.0.1 entry.**" msgstr "" "Certaines distributions ajoutent une entrée superflue dans le fichier ``/etc/" "hosts`` qui résout le hostname actuel en une autre adresse IP de loopback " "comme ``127.0.1.1``. Vous devez commenter ou supprimer cette entrée pour " "éviter des problèmes de résolution de nom. **Attention à ne pas supprimer " "l'entrée 127.0.0.1.**" "The self-service networks option augments the provider networks option with " "layer-3 (routing) services that enable :term:`self-service` networks using " "overlay segmentation methods such as :term:`VXLAN`. Essentially, it routes " "virtual networks to physical networks using :term:`NAT`. Additionally, this " "option provides the foundation for advanced services such as LBaaS and FWaaS." msgstr "" "L'option de réseaux libres-services améliore l'option de réseaux " "fournisseurs avec des services de couche-3 (routing) qui permettent la " "création de réseaux :term:`libres-services` utilisant des techniques de " "segmentation overlay comme :term:`VXLAN`. Essentiellement, cela permet de " "router les réseaux virtuels vers les réseaux physiques via le :term:`NAT`. " "De plus, cette option sert de base aux services avancés comme LBaaS et FWaaS." msgid ""msgid "" "This option lacks support for self-service (private) networks, layer-3 " "(routing) services, and advanced services such as :term:`LBaaS` and :term:" "`FWaaS`. Consider the self-service networks option if you desire these " "features." msgstr "" "Cette option ne permet pas le support des réseaux self-service (privés), des " "services de niveau-3 (routage), et des services avancés comme :term:`LBaaS` " "et :term:`FWaaS`. Envisager l'option des réseaux self-service si vous " "souhaitez ces fonctionnalités." "To reduce complexity of this guide, we add host entries for optional " "services regardless of whether you choose to deploy them." msgstr "" "Pour simplifier ce guide, on ajoute des entrées pour les services " "optionnels, même si vous pouvez choisir de ne pas les déployer." msgid """You must :ref:`install and configure a storage node <cinder-storage>` prior " "to installing and configuring the backup service." msgstr "" "Vous devez :ref:`installer et configurer un nœud de stockage <cinder-" "storage>` avant d'installer et configurer le service de sauvegarde." msgid ""

commit_message:
Add crypt algorithm to digest

Unix password hashes are generated using crypt(3). This commit adds
crypt to the digest intrinsic function and adds an option map as an
optional 3rd argument. Initially, the only option is 'salt', which is
required to use crypt and also simplifies creating salted hashes using
the other algorithms.

Change-Id: If3e3d63029c3f9f05ddace065f4243d3551b5015
Implements: blueprint digest-add-crypt

added_lines: def test_digest_empty_options(self): snippet = {'digest': ['md5', 'foobar', {}]} snippet_resolved = '3858f62230ac3c915f300c664312c63f' tmpl = template.Template(hot_kilo_tpl_empty) self.assertEqual(snippet_resolved, self.resolve(snippet, tmpl)) def test_digest_salt(self): snippet = {'digest': ['md5', 'bar', {'salt': 'foo'}]} snippet_resolved = '3858f62230ac3c915f300c664312c63f' tmpl = template.Template(hot_kilo_tpl_empty) self.assertEqual(snippet_resolved, self.resolve(snippet, tmpl)) def test_digest_crypt(self): snippet = {'digest': ['crypt', 'password', {'salt': '$6$mpkWDT/A'}]} snippet_resolved = ('$6$mpkWDT/A$CUkCivQH4W4fSrtFxHoirLvvoifIp51RJroOmA' '8Zgc7/jdhMiVFy1e6brkjW.LAp07f6obXK0PXN8AG1R8KX60') tmpl = template.Template(hot_kilo_tpl_empty) self.assertEqual(snippet_resolved, self.resolve(snippet, tmpl)) self.assertIn('must be a list', six.text_type(exc)) {'digest': ['md5', 'foo', 'bar', 'baz']}, self.assertIn( 'must have algorithm, value, and optionally an options map.', six.text_type(exc)) def test_digest_invalid_algorithm_type(self): tmpl = template.Template(hot_kilo_tpl_empty) invalid_snippets = [ {'digest': [123, 'bar']}, {'digest': [123, 'bar', 'baz']}, ] for snippet in invalid_snippets: exc = self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.resolve, snippet, tmpl) self.assertIn('Algorithm in function', six.text_type(exc)) self.assertIn('must be a string', six.text_type(exc)) def test_digest_invalid_value_type(self): tmpl = template.Template(hot_kilo_tpl_empty) invalid_snippets = [ {'digest': ['bar', 123]}, {'digest': ['bar', 123, 'baz']}, ] for snippet in invalid_snippets: exc = self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.resolve, snippet, tmpl) self.assertIn('Value in function', six.text_type(exc)) self.assertIn('must be a string', six.text_type(exc)) def test_digest_invalid_options_type(self): tmpl = template.Template(hot_kilo_tpl_empty) invalid_snippets = [ {'digest': ['bar', 'baz', []]}, {'digest': ['sha512', 'foo', 'options']}, {'digest': ['sha512', 'foo', 1234]}, ] for snippet in invalid_snippets: exc = self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.resolve, snippet, tmpl) self.assertIn('Options in function', six.text_type(exc)) self.assertIn('must be a map', six.text_type(exc)) def test_digest_crypt_missing_salt(self): tmpl = template.Template(hot_kilo_tpl_empty) invalid_snippets = [ {'digest': ['crypt', 'password']}, {'digest': ['crypt', 'password', {}]}, ] for snippet in invalid_snippets: exc = self.assertRaises(ValueError, self.resolve, snippet, tmpl) self.assertIn('crypt algorithm requires salt', six.text_type(exc)) def test_digest_invalid_salt_type(self): tmpl = template.Template(hot_kilo_tpl_empty) invalid_snippets = [ {'digest': ['md5', 'bar', {'salt': {}}]}, {'digest': ['crypt', 'password', {'salt': 123}]} ] for snippet in invalid_snippets: exc = self.assertRaises(TypeError, self.resolve, snippet, tmpl) self.assertIn('Value of "salt"', six.text_type(exc)) self.assertIn('must be a string', six.text_type(exc))

commit_message:
Revert "Router namespace not created in controller".

Issue has been fixed in Neutron. See patch
https://review.openstack.org/290470

This reverts commit 7334c3cfee12a81657296fa0e90c7d25457de9f6.

Change-Id: I0889106367ef0723ea955b09623b804e9b4e76b9

The created' ' router has been deleted, as the overall' ' operation failed.') % data['name'] LOG.info(message) redirect = reverse(self.failure_url) exceptions.handle(request, message, redirect=redirect) return False except Exception: message = _('Router %(name)s was created but connecting to' ' an external network failed. Attempts to' ' delete the new router also failed.' subject: Disable l2gw cli extension

- It needs networking-l2gw installed, but we don't want to make it
  a hard requirement right now

- It uses the duplicated entry ("l2_gateway") as the one provided by
  networking-l2gw project

Closes-Bug: #1599043
Related-Bug: #1580566

commit_message:
Disable l2gw cli extension

Disable our variant of l2gw cli extension for now because:

- It needs networking-l2gw installed, but we don't want to make it
  a hard requirement right now

- It uses the duplicated entry ("l2_gateway") as the one provided by
  networking-l2gw project

Closes-Bug: #1599043
Related-Bug: #1580566
Change-Id: Ia6d40a8f66adc649c5d85828fb371f07f2e72199

commit_message:
Revert "Don't assert exact to_dict output"

We discussed this at the mid-cycle and this wasn't the direction we
agreed to.

Known the exact format enables nova to understand issues with cross
release upgrade.

This reverts commit 9f99f6c212c38f8ae26c6aeee4b4521cbf9207a4.

Change-Id: I9ff2e7de5ba7691e302a29e6120d8a1d21db8cfb

commit_message:
Switch all xstatic projects to the correct publish job

publish-to-pypi isn't the correct publish template for xstatic packeages
instead it shoudl be xstatic-publish-jobs, as this understand the
versioning scheme in use.

Update all xstatic packages to the corerct publish template.

Change-Id: I759019f38b6a535e978d75cb95f1fc0db9597390

commit_message:
Python 3: add support

The patche does the following:
1. remove nested with calls from unit tests
2. updates tox.ini to enable us to use the \ at the end
   of a line
3. All integers in python 3 are long.
4. Python 3 does not support __builtin__. Removed it from the tests.

Now the unit tests pass when running python 3.

This also adds support to tox.

Change-Id: Iacbf0c2c05248819af817109e7dd637f71c82404

commit_message:
Add check for member id

If the member id contain the character '#', it can't be delete
anymore. Because the request url can't analysis this kind of id.

And the member id means project(tenant) id which contains only
numbers and letters.

So we should keep the same with keystone's project id and should
contain only numbers and letters in the member id.

lite spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/315388/

APIimpact

Change-Id: I9294d3c4431fff5946d6ae9f969130cb4e43e750
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/15/310115/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not member_id or not member_id.isalnum(): msg = _("Member can't be empty and should contain only numbers " "and letters")
deleted_lines: if not member_id: msg = _("Member can't be empty")

commit_message:
Add cluster job distribution

This patch adds a new mechanism to distribute jobs to c-vol nodes with
the addition of the "cluster" configuration option.

DocImpact: New cluster configuration option
Specs: https://review.openstack.org/327283
Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: Id0a2e4c6a7b5f17e4ee3484ae1b53c03d472b586

commit_message:
improved scaling for cdh plugin

this fixes issues with decommissioning nodes,
when gateway nodes are included. additionally,
restarting of stale services are required to
for redeployment of configs.

Change-Id: I9d439936c0e2f851054735f0defba8efc592c84d

commit_message:
Define default region name.

If multiple regions exist, keystone_authtoken should contain region_name.
This prevents the service from authenticating across regions.

Also set default for all services to the region heat is installed in.

Change-Id: I14b2d145b52c1d396ac22c724a5b9ecb8fa7929e

added_lines: keystone_service_region: RegionOne

commit_message:
Update tox.ini: Constraints are possible for api* jobs

OpenStack CI setup has been changed so that api jobs can
use constraints, remove the extra install_command.

Depends-On: I8f45a53429b9fcbf3689a268f096afdf5f32f461

commit_message:
Use osc_lib instead of cliff

Base classes of commands are defined in cliff,
but have been encapsulated again in osc-lib
for all plugin clients. So use osc-lib instead of cliff.

Change-Id: I090da28b6d2bbea7eaa1a6503910ab38dfebf422
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/02/340202/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from osc_lib.command import commandclass ListQuota(neutronV20.NeutronCommand, command.Lister):class ShowQuota(neutronV20.NeutronCommand, command.ShowOne):class UpdateQuota(neutronV20.NeutronCommand, command.ShowOne):
deleted_lines: from cliff import lister from cliff import showclass ListQuota(neutronV20.NeutronCommand, lister.Lister):class ShowQuota(neutronV20.NeutronCommand, show.ShowOne):class UpdateQuota(neutronV20.NeutronCommand, show.ShowOne):

commit_message:
tests: stop using ml2 plugin full import paths in tests

Stevedore documentation suggest that full import paths are not supposed
to be user visible. Since unit tests emulate users when configuring
oslo.config, we better off relying on well known plugin aliases than
internal details.

For in-tree that may be not a big deal, but with it we set a bad example
for third parties that may later find their tests broken eg. when we
decide to move code around.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7bd036ac3df7e7f4c678356d0a793e7d38599dda

commit_message:
Fix dict.keys() PY3 compatible

The dict.keys()[0] will raise a TypeError in PY3
as dict.keys() doesn't return a list any more in PY3
but a view of list.

Change-Id: Ib58f7130352aa4c2a4bae3a830a5a83ee8a711d1
Closes-Bug: #1583419

 3. Builds OSC plugin structure for tacker commands and
unit tests. Such as: VNF, VNFD, VIM, EXT.

The OSC plugin system is a command set for following OpenStack
services: Compute, Identity, Image, Object Storage, Block Storage
and Network. Other OpenStack services, such as Orchestration or
Telemetry may create an OpenStackClient plugin.So Tacker can do the
same.
Here is OSC plugin links:
  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-openstackclient/plugins.html

Here is the blueprint(Tacker OpenStackClient plugin )links:
  https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/tacker-openstackclient-plugin

commit_message:
Base OpenStackClient(OSC) plugin support for Tacker

This patch enable tackerclient OSC plugin support. This
patch set does the following:
 1. Adds OSC to test-requirement.txt, setup.cfg
 2. Creates the OSC plugin
 3. Builds OSC plugin structure for tacker commands and
unit tests. Such as: VNF, VNFD, VIM, EXT.

The OSC plugin system is a command set for following OpenStack
services: Compute, Identity, Image, Object Storage, Block Storage
and Network. Other OpenStack services, such as Orchestration or
Telemetry may create an OpenStackClient plugin.So Tacker can do the
same.
Here is OSC plugin links:
  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-openstackclient/plugins.html

Here is the blueprint(Tacker OpenStackClient plugin )links:
  https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/tacker-openstackclient-plugin

Change-Id: I0f0db1b25dbff501058e81e59cbde5d49f62c46d

commit_message:
Updates to image CLI from implementation

Minor changes to feature implementation, including:
- PLUGIN and PLUGIN_VERSION proved much more elegant to
  implement as subcommands than as normal arguments.
- Addition of root-filesystem arg to handle the rare
  case in which libguestfs cannot detect the correct
  root filesystem of the image.
- Variable name changes (longform only).
- Removal of multiple argument name options for image
  arguments (why add complexity or obscurity?)
- Minor change to pack_image signature.
- Fixed "variable" vs. "argument" naming convnetion
  in the ArgumentCaseValidator.

Change-Id: Idece2ed546d9e3365b3d4850d7d29f112da10be8
Describes: blueprint image-generation-cli

added_lines: --image IMAGE_PATH [--root-filesystem] [--test] PLUGIN PLUGIN_VERSION * --image: The path to an image to modify. This image will be modified in-place: be sure to target a copy if you wish to maintain a clean master image. * --root-filesystem: The filesystem to mount as the root volume on the image. No value is required if only one filesystem is detected. * --test-only: If this flag is set, no changes will be made to the image; instead, the script will fail if discrepancies are found between the image and the intended state.Both PLUGIN and PLUGIN_VERSION will be implemented as required subcommands. If --test-only is set, the image will be packed with the ``reconcile`` option set to False (meaning that the image will only be tested, not changed.) choices:1) All argnames must be unique, and no argnames may collide with global script2) If required is false, a default value must be provided. 3) The target_variable field is required, for clarity. def pack_image(self, hadoop_version, remote, reconcile=True, image_arguments=None)3) Generate a set of ImageValidators (just as is done for image validation).

This image will be modified in-place: be sure to target a copy if you wish to maintain a clean master image. * -p, --plugin: The name of the Sahara plugin for which you would like to generate an image. Use sahara-image-create -p PLUGIN -h to see a set of versions for a specific plugin. * -v, --version: The version of the Sahara plugin for which you would like to generate an image. Use sahara-image-create -p PLUGIN -v VERSION -h to see a full set of arguments for a specific plugin and version. * -t, --test: If this flag is set, no changes will be made to the image; instead, the script will fail if discrepancies are found between the image and the intended state.If -t is set, the image will be packed with the ``reconcile`` option set to False (meaning that the image will only be tested, not changed.) argnames: [j, java-version] enum:1) At least one argname must be provided for each argument. 2) Argnames may contain up to one single-letter member and up to one multiple- letter member. 3) All argnames must be unique, and no argnames may collide with global script4) If required is false, a default value must be provided. 5) The target_variable field is required, for clarity. def pack_image(remote, reconcile=True, argument_map=None, **kwargs)3) Generate a set of ImageValidators (just as is done for image validation)

commit_message:
enabling L2GW to work with DVR

In DVR mode no host IP is associated with the L3 Agent because
the router is configured on all the Compute Nodes and on the Network Node.
To overcome this problem we look for L3 Agent that is running on the Network Node,
resolve the hostname of the Network Node to get its IP address and use it to
configure the destination IP needed for neutron port location information.

Closes-Bug: 1463784

Change-Id: I2595c714ede896baa7726ceec793de9a7a29e6b2

subject: Call release_dhcp via RPC to ensure correct host
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-03 15:20:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/64a396f7f44bf6a32440e322c724cfa824faaee1', 'message': 'Call release_dhcp via RPC to ensure correct host

When deleting an instance in a nova-network environment, the network
manager calls release_dhcp() on the local host. The linux_net driver
then executes dhcp_release, a binary that comes with dnsmasq that
releases a DHCP lease on the local host. Upon lease release, dnsmasq
calls its dhcp-script, nova-dhcpbridge. The latter calls
release_fixed_ip() and the instance's fixed IP is returned to the
pool. This is fine if an instance has never been live-migrated.

If an instance has been live-migrated, the dnsmasq on its new
host fails with 'unknown lease' because it's not the same dnsmasq that
originally handed out the lease. Having failed, dnsmasq doesn't call
nova-dhcpbridge and release_fixed_ip() is never called. The fixed IP
is not returned to the pool and a new instance cannot be booted with
that IP.

This patches adds a release_dhcp RPC call that calls release_dhcp on
the instance's "original" host, thus ensuring that the correct dnsmasq
handles the lease release and that nova-dhcpbridge and
release_fixed_ip() are called.

Change-Id: I0eec8c995dd8cff50c37af83018697fc686fe727
Closes-bug: 1585601

commit_message:
Call release_dhcp via RPC to ensure correct host

When deleting an instance in a nova-network environment, the network
manager calls release_dhcp() on the local host. The linux_net driver
then executes dhcp_release, a binary that comes with dnsmasq that
releases a DHCP lease on the local host. Upon lease release, dnsmasq
calls its dhcp-script, nova-dhcpbridge. The latter calls
release_fixed_ip() and the instance's fixed IP is returned to the
pool. This is fine if an instance has never been live-migrated.

If an instance has been live-migrated, the dnsmasq on its new
host fails with 'unknown lease' because it's not the same dnsmasq that
originally handed out the lease. Having failed, dnsmasq doesn't call
nova-dhcpbridge and release_fixed_ip() is never called. The fixed IP
is not returned to the pool and a new instance cannot be booted with
that IP.

This patches adds a release_dhcp RPC call that calls release_dhcp on
the instance's "original" host, thus ensuring that the correct dnsmasq
handles the lease release and that nova-dhcpbridge and
release_fixed_ip() are called.

Change-Id: I0eec8c995dd8cff50c37af83018697fc686fe727
Closes-bug: 1585601

commit_message:
Fix 'reconfigure' command of kolla

Changed the order of the 'when' statements in "remove/restart
containers" tasks. It will fix the reconfiguration problem when
deploying different components on different hosts.

Change-Id: Ibee9dd56b6128b664144deb1d9eb7ec32e39fd5c
Closes-Bug: #1603943

subject: always use pip constraints
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-10 12:18:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/81280b6bfcadc99b27c0bb99ae3be3f1d0ccdf25', 'message': 'always use pip constraints

This flips the tox.ini to always use constraints installation for
all targets. It drops the extra -constraints targets in the process.
This makes it so there is no developer change required to operate in our
new world order.

This flips the tox.ini to always use constraints installation for
all targets. It drops the extra -constraints targets in the process.
This makes it so there is no developer change required to operate in our
new world order.

Depends-On: Iecd35d6bc3b1e9e0ed31b48a34e4149d34d55ac2

commit_message:
always use pip constraints

This flips the tox.ini to always use constraints installation for
all targets. It drops the extra -constraints targets in the process.
This makes it so there is no developer change required to operate in our
new world order.

Change-Id: I2b56835edb2d75b7c871aae030e909578dbb9
Depends-On: I0b582ac2c7c227faf72bf701dfa88e83a8ba9ee6
Depends-On: Iecd35d6bc3b1e9e0ed31b48a34e4149d34d55ac2
Closes-Bug: #1599855
(cherry picked from commit 379f272924f1e3946f8eb08eb9690e42d09b0a29)

commit_message:
Use "arp -n" when finding gateway MAC for netconsole

arp can resolve the gateway address to something unhelpful like
"gateway" which fails the grep.  Avoid this.

Change-Id: I236b7080774fef8700d0ec056d9703eb98f90204
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/00/348100/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local gw_mac=$(arp -n $default_gw | grep $default_gw | awk '{print $3}')

commit_message:
Bring models in sync with migrations, add test

Bring the sqlalchemy models in sync with the alembic migrations.

Add the neutron standard model-migration sync test. The test is added
to the unit test env since l2gw does not have a functional job
yet. This requires that l2gw uses the python-db-jobs template in the
gate.

(Also remove downgrades since they are not supported.)

Closes-Bug: #1605675

Depends-On: I3a8ea02b86846e9a8a7d7f2aee9700ca952b0248

Change-Id: Ib73f554d5f0bbfbe25a0f6ad33b23e4584800e21

subject: Revert "allow binding to vlan 0"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 07:06:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-l2gw/commit/88e7db9548ad40481e30316467f59348db2bc5f4', 'message': 'Revert "allow binding to vlan 0"

A primary key cannot be nullable. MySQL is silent about it, but PostgreSQL will give you errors. I am not sure yet how to fix this, but for now I think it is best to revert this and rethink.

This reverts commit 782271f5db2e6fc43b04d12c9e03f4dda2fe043e.

commit_message:
tox.ini: Change the way to exclude l2gw tests for py34/py35

The previous way was necessary to avoid import-time errors for
bgp plugin tests.  Now bgp plugin was fixed, [1] it's no longer
necessary.

The new way would allow concurrent test runs, which might
improve the situation for the Related-Bug.

[1] I1585a84f1fa2722b36a733a4a9551b7a0d3de210

Related-Bug: #1604649
Change-Id: Ib1cab9a5f2dcc6faa0210cd5a0cfcb77c48dfcfa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/53/347653/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = ostestr --regex \ '{posargs:^(?!.*(?:test_extension_l2gateway)).*$}'commands = ostestr --regex \ '{posargs:^(?!.*(?:test_extension_l2gateway)).*$}'

commit_message:
Developer Registry Resource Browser

Developer dashboard panel which shows:
- resource types currently in the resource registry browser
- the details that are set for each resource type
- links to generic table views (if available)
- available actions (with WIP mechanism to exercise the action)

To test:
- Open Developer -> Resources
- notice how Images item is green
- exercise some of the global actions (create image)
- enter an image id to exercise the item actions
- batch actions not currently testable
- click the images "Generic Table View" link

Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-registry
Change-Id: Ib931fac9917a50c268b2e63ff7a0de42052c62c8

added_lines: ## Monasca Datasource - A datasource for use with the OpenStack Monasca api. For more information on Monasca see the [Monasca documentation](https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Monasca) When combined with Grafana Keystone authentication this datasource supports using login credentials to authenticate queries.

commit_message:
Remove task result for collection REST requests

* Task result should be not be included when a collection of
  task executions is requested because: 1) practically result
  of individual task may be long 2) in order to extract it we
  have to query action executions for every task execution,
  the result operation becomes extremely heavy even for small
  data sets. If task result is needed it should be requested
  individually. This behavior was broken during the recent
  refactoring in API layer.
* Other minor changes

Change-Id: I46697e24d826bd2b705ca61b188e9bed66888876

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 23:25:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/volume/cinder.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cc5d2b56fd5d414fbeb66109b7ba80b9ac780fc1', 'message': 'Implement new attach/detach Cinder flow

***************** WIP/POC ********************
Lots of details to address here, but this is a quick POC
to show a new workflow using Cinder create/remove attachment.

Goal of this patch was just to make this work for the standard
attach/detach path.  Still has a few places that need updated,
also we'll want to add some things on Cinder's side like a
refresh connection_info (rather than calling initialize_connection).

Currently we still use reserve etc, but we consolidate
initialize_connection and attach calls into a single
"create_attachment" call.

Same with terminate and destach, we combine those into a single
"remove_attachment" call.

Things that need to be done:
* Clearly there are quite a few places we still need to update (or we can leave
them calling the old mechanism).  The good thing about this approach is it's
not a BigBang change, we can keep using old methods at the same time.

* Take a look at the cleanup of connections (ie rm /dev/disk-by-path) and
  use either the return from list_attachments, or remove_attachment to
  determine if/when we should delete that connection (think multi-attach)

* API micro-versioning?

* Unit tests of course

Change-Id: I9c07a7282e57aa2decce1ca06b6a70b399432f8d
